MRS. MADGE LAW

It has been a privilege and a pleasure to serve the NAEB as
Chairman of the Membership Committee. I want to take this
occasion for again commending the members of the committee
and the headquarter's staff for assisting in any progress made.
Personally, I feel that two years as chairman of an NAEB com¬
mittee can pretty well absorb any individual's ability to contri¬
bute; therefore, I request that the assignment not be repeated as
far as my case is concerned. I hope this is not presumptuous
on my part that you would even consider such, but it is intended
as a suggestion in the interest of our association. My personal
attitude in this respect does not apply to individual members of
this committee for, in certain instances, they have developed
techniques and skills that might well serve to chair the com¬
mittee itself. Ted Sherburne comes to mind as one such member.
My attitude on the chairmanship of the Membership Committee
does not hold when other services to the NAEB are concerned. I
say this in a sense of loyalty to the NAEB, but in no wise as a
request. Please know that I am at your service.
Please confirm the verbally made engagement for the NAEB Region 11
Conference. As you may recall, you were agreeable to speaking
at the Professional Breakfast of NAEB Region 11 Conference to be
held at the Atlanta Biltmore Hotel, Saturday ,morning, April 22,
